definition: seal impression/stamp/mark from a seal serving as signature
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image
example/mirror/to view/reflection/to reflect/to inspect/to warn/(ancient bronze mirror)

sentences.english: Chop garlic for orange pepper chicken to incorporate into the rice side dish.
sentences.chinese: 印鉴橙色辣椒大蒜鸡肉饭纳入小菜。

sentences.english: This paper proposes a novel approach of seal imprint identification using geometrical statistic features.
sentences.chinese: 提出一种基于几何统计特征的印鉴识别方法。

sentences.english: Your signature card would be kept in this folder.
sentences.chinese: 你的印鉴卡就放正在账夹内。

sentences.english: The registration results of high precision are obtained by the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 通过实验获得了两幅印鉴图象的高精度配准结果。

definition: signature (in grass-style writing)/symbol used in place of a signature (on a document, contract etc)
official seal/imperial or royal seal/papal bull
to affix a seal/to stamp (a document)
inscription with name, date, or short sentence, on a painting, gift, letter etc
red ink paste used for seal
